abstract: Home Depot’s new chief  is working to return the chain to its humble retail roots and erase the perception that it has lost its focus.
snippet: Home Depot’s new chief  is working to return the chain to its humble retail roots and erase the perception that it has lost its focus.
lead_paragraph: For six years, it was a perk that Home Depot’s chief executive, Robert L. Nardelli, could not do without: a catered lunch for his top deputies, served daily on the 22nd floor of the company’s headquarters in Atlanta.

headline.main: Home Depot Gets a Fresh Coat of Less-Glossy Paint
headline.print_headline: Home Depot Gets a Fresh Coat Of Less-Glossy Paint
